summary:
Reindeer, also known as caribou, are a type of deer found in cold regions like the Arctic and subarctic. They live in Europe, Siberia, and North America. There are different kinds, or species, of reindeer, and some travel long distances. These animals can vary in size and color. Female reindeer can have antlers, which is unique among deer.

People have used reindeer for food, clothes, and even to pull sleds. In folklore, Santa Claus's reindeer fly through the sky on Christmas Eve.
title: Reindeer
